sen.j: 今出川 公規（いまでがわ きんのり、寛永15年1月12日 (旧暦)（1638年2月25日） - 元禄10年10月26日 (旧暦)（1697年12月8日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Kinnori IMAGAWA (born on February 25, 1638 and died on December 8, 1697) was Kugyo (court noble) in the early Edo period.
Kinnori IMAGAWA (February 25, 1638 - December 8, 1697) was Kugyo (court noble) in the early Edo period.
Kinnori IMAGAWA (February 25, 1638 - December 8, 1697) was Kugyo (court noble) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 後光明天皇（110代）から東山天皇（113代）の四朝にわたって仕え、官位は従一位右大臣まで昇る。
sen.e: He served four Emperors from the Emperor Gokomyo (the 110th) to the Emperor Hgashiyama (the 113th) and he rose to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, the minister of the right).
He served four Emperors from the Emperor Gokomyo (the 110th) to the Emperor Hgashiyama (the 113th) and he rose to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, the minister of the right).
He served four Emperors from the Emperor Gokomyo (the 110th) to the Emperor Hgashiyama (the 113th) and he rose to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, the minister of the right).

sen.j: 父は内大臣徳大寺公信。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin (the minister of the center), Kinnobu DAITOKUJI.
His father was Naidaijin (the minister of the center), Kinnobu DAITOKUJI.
His father was Naidaijin (the minister of the center), Kinnobu DAITOKUJI.

sen.j: 母は長州藩主毛利秀就の養女（岩国藩主吉川広正の娘）。
sen.e: His mother was an adopted daughter of the lord of the Choshu clan, Hidenari MORI (a daughter of the lord of the Iwakuni clan, Hiromasa KIKKAWA).
His mother was an adopted daughter of the lord of the Choshu clan, Hidenari MORI (a daughter of the lord of the Iwakuni clan, Hiromasa KIKKAWA).
His mother was an adopted daughter of the lord of the Choshu clan, Hidenari MORI (a daughter of the lord of the Iwakuni clan, Hiromasa KIKKAWA).

sen.j: 養父は右大臣今出川経季。
sen.e: His foster father was Udaijin, Tsunesue IMAGAWA.
His foster father was Udaijin, Tsunesue IMAGAWA.
His foster father was Udaijin, Tsunesue IMAGAWA.

sen.j: 室に丸亀藩主京極高和の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of the lord of the Marukame clan, Takakazu KYOGOKU.
His lawful wife was a daughter of the lord of the Marukame clan, Takakazu KYOGOKU.
His lawful wife was a daughter of the lord of the Marukame clan, Takakazu KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 息子に右大臣今出川伊季、娘に水戸藩主徳川綱条室、常陸府中藩主松平頼明室がいる。
sen.e: Udaijin, Koresue IMADEGAWA was his son and a wife of the lord of the Mito clan, Tsunaeda Tokugawa and a wife of the lord of the Hitachifuchu clan, Yoriaki MATSUDAIRA. were his daughters.
Udaijin, Koresue IMADEGAWA was his son and a wife of the lord of the Mito clan, Tsunaeda Tokugawa and a wife of the lord of the Hitachifuchu clan, Yoriaki MATSUDAIRA, were his daughters.
sen.cmt: ピリオドをカンマに変更しました。
sen.e: Udaijin, Koresue IMADEGAWA was his son and a wife of the lord of the Mito clan, Tsunaeda Tokugawa and a wife of the lord of the Hitachifuchu clan, Yoriaki MATSUDAIRA, were his daughters.
In 1645, the peerage was conferred on him.
In 1645, the peerage was conferred on him.
In 1645, the peerage was conferred on him.

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として早いスピードで昇進し、侍従・近衛府少将・近衛府中将を経て、万治2年（1659年）に従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: He got promoted rapidly as the family head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Konoefu shosho (Minor Captain of the Inner Palace Guards) and Konoefu chujo (Middle Captain of the Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1659, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BB%8A%E5%87%BA%E5%B7%9D%E5%85%AC%E8%A6%8Fより、「近衛府・近衛府を経て」→「近衛府少将・近衛府中将を経て」に変更しました。
sen.e: He got promoted rapidly as the family head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Konoefu shosho (Minor Captain of the Inner Palace Guards) and Konoefu chujo (Middle Captain of the Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1659, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.

He got promoted rapidly as the family head of the Seiga family taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Konoefu shosho (Minor Captain of the Inner Palace Guards) and Konoefu chujo (Middle Captain of the Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1659, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.

sen.j: 権中納言を経て、寛文4年（1664年）に権大納言。
sen.e: In 1664, he got promoted from Chunagon (the vice-councilor of the state) to Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state).
In 1664, he got promoted from Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 原文の「大納言」「中納言」の部分が、ウィキでは「権大納言」「権中納言」になっていて、「大納言」「中納言」はリンク先のようです。
sen.e: In 1664, he got promoted from Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state)→Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state)

sen.j: 延宝6年（1678年）には右近衛大将に補され、さらにその翌年には右馬寮御監を兼務。
sen.e: In 1678, he took a post in Konoefu and in 1679, he took an additional post of Meryo (the section taking care of the Imperial horses).

In 1678, he took a post of Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and in 1679, he took an additional post of Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).
sen.cmt: 原文の「近衛府」「馬寮」の部分が、ウィキでは「右近衛大将」「右馬寮御監」となっていて、「近衛府」「馬寮」はリンク先のようです。
sen.e: In 1678, he took a post of Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and in 1679, he took an additional post of Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).

sen.j: 天和 (日本)3年（1683年）からその翌年にかけては内大臣の地位にあった。
sen.e: From 1683 to 1684, he was in the position of Naidaijin (the minister of the center).
From 1683 to 1684, he was in the position of Naidaijin (the minister of the center).
From 1683 to 1684, he was in the position of Naidaijin (the minister of the center).

sen.j: 元禄5年（1692年）からその翌年にかけては右大臣をつとめる。
sen.e: From 1692 to 1693, he served as Udaijin.
From 1692 to 1693, he served as Udaijin.
From 1692 to 1693, he served as Udaijin.

sen.j: 元禄7年（1694年）に従一位に進む。
sen.e: In 1694, he rose to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1694, he rose to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1694, he rose to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
